metadata.title: CVE-2021-33033 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The Linux kernel before 5.11.14 has a use-after-free in cipso_v4_genopt innet/ipv4/cipso_ipv4.c because the CIPSO and CALIPSO refcounting for the DOIdefinitions is mishandled, aka CID-ad5d07f4a9cd. This leads to writing anarbitrary value.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-33033` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-222-generic - 4.4.0-222.255
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-222-generic - 4.4.0-222.255
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-222-lowlatency - 4.4.0-222.255
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-144-generic - 4.15.0-144.148~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-144-generic - 4.15.0-144.148~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-144-lowlatency - 4.15.0-144.148~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1103-kvm - 4.4.0-1103.112
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1138-aws - 4.4.0-1138.152
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1103-aws - 4.15.0-1103.110~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1115-azure - 4.15.0-1115.128~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1100-gcp - 4.15.0-1100.113~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1072-oracle - 4.15.0-1072.80~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-222.255').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-144.148~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1103.112').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1138.152').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1103.110~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1115.128~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1100.113~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1072.80~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-snapdragon: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-fips package in fips/xenial is affected and needs fixing.
